definition[0]: the land and buildings of a university or college, including the buildings where students live
example[0]: a beautiful campus in New England
example[1]: Most first-year students live on campus.
definition[1]: the land and buildings belonging to a large company
definition[2]: an area of land where a university has its buildings and facilities
example[4]: Berkeley is the oldest of the University of California campuses.
definition[3]: a large area where a company has many buildings
example[5]: Microsoft Corp. opened a 32-acre campus in Silicon Valley.
